node.title: British teen finds Bronze Age axes on just third outing with metal detector
node.alt: A young girl with a shovel over her shoulder.
node.description: Amelia Hardwick, aÂ 13-year-old from Suffolk, has unearthed a hoard of axes dating back to 1300 BC on just her third dig, becoming the envy of her competitors with decades of experience.
node.content:
["A 13-year-old metal detectorist has found a \"once-in-a-lifetime\" Bronze Age axe hoard on just her third dig.", "Amelia Hardwick, who is\u00a0in year 8\u00a0at school, has become a poster girl for metal detecting, striking gold almost every week despite being some four decades younger than the typical detectorist.", "Her mother Claire, 48, said: \"On a couple of digs people have gone, 'Oh God, she's here now so we might as well go home!'\"", "Amelia, from Mildenhall, Suffolk, made an astounding discovery of an axe hoard dating back to 1300 BC on just her third time out in a field near Royston, Herts.", "", "
Amelia says she \"never comes back empty handed\".(South West News Service via Reuters)
", "Archaeologists had to excavate the find \u2014 made up of 65 pieces \u2014 and Amelia took Monday off school to formally sign it over to the local coroner.", "Amelia got into the hobby through her father. The pair now dig around their local area every Sunday.", "\"I came along on a couple of them and on every single dig I found something good,\" she said.", "Despite the significance of her find, the teenager\u00a0is still modest about her accomplishments when around\u00a0her friends.", "\"Only a few of them\u00a0know, but the ones that know, they didn't quite understand so I had to explain it to them,\" she said.", "Reuters"]
